column4: how do I connect to a local win32 computers shared folder/drive?  The destination is already shared, and viewable by other win32 machines.  I've installed samba
gnome or kde?
gnome.
do you want to permanently mount the remote folder?
well... I'd like to learn both... perm and temp.
smbmount
it's a laptop (ubuntu) trying to connect to my winXP sp2 workstation.
mount -t smbfs -o username=tridge,password=foobar //fjall/test /data/test
bit different if you're putting it in your /etc/fstab
thank you.  now how's it different in the fstab?
and a credential file is a handy thing...//slave/stuff   /mnt/stuff      smbfs   credentials=/root/.smb_slave_stuff,auto,rw,dmask=777,fmask=777  0       0
thanks.
you're welcome.
What happens when there is no password for a share?  I did sudo mount -t smbfs //192.168.1.100/e
username=,password=
leave them blank
sudo mount -t smbfs -o username=,password= //192.168.1.100/e still spits back wrong fs type.
mount_data version 1919251317 is not supported
odd.
sudo apt-get install smbfs fixed it.
sorry. my bad. i knew that.
np... you pointed me to smbfs... I didn't even know that... or I forget it at least. :)
